bibl.title: Isis, the Crocodiles and the Mysteries of the Nile Floods: Interpreting a Scene from Roman Egypt Exhibited in the Egyptian Museum in Cairo (JE 30001).
bibl.note: Le Caire, JE 30001 [ed.: C.C. Edgar, Greek Sculpture. Catalogue général du Musée du Caire (Le Caire, 1903) p. 55, No. 27569]. - 1. The offering to the enthroned deity: 1.1. A crocodile in the lap?; - 1.2. With or without beard; - 1.3. Falcon and crocodile; - 1.4. The Osirian regeneration. - 2. ""I am the one who rises in the dog star"" (Kyme aretalogy, 9; 1st century BC). - 3. Gods in arms.

bibl.title: "Demeter, Isis, Vesta, and Cybele. Studies in Greek and Roman Religion in Honour of Giulia Sfameni Gasparro"

bibl.seg: Gaëlle Tallet, Isis, the Crocodiles and the Mysteries of the Nile Floods: Interpreting a Scene from Roman Egypt Exhibited in the Egyptian Museum in Cairo (JE 30001).

Attilio Mastrocinque & Concetta Giuffré Scibona (edd.), Demeter, Isis, Vesta, and Cybele. Studies in Greek and Roman Religion in Honour of Giulia Sfameni Gasparro = Potsdamer Altertumswissenschaftliche Beiträge. 36 (Stuttgart, 2012) pp. 139-163, 8 figg.

Le Caire, JE 30001 [ed.: C.C. Edgar, Greek Sculpture. Catalogue général du Musée du Caire (Le Caire, 1903) p. 55, No. 27569]. - 1. The offering to the enthroned deity: 1.1. A crocodile in the lap?; - 1.2. With or without beard; - 1.3. Falcon and crocodile; - 1.4. The Osirian regeneration. - 2. ""I am the one who rises in the dog star"" (Kyme aretalogy, 9; 1st century BC). - 3. Gods in arms.
